2461.63.text:
Now, it had been good before Adam fell, completely
good, but he was fallible. He had only what

2472.41.text:
Paul called a natural body. With Adam, there
was a tree to avoid. There was a serpent.

2485.80.text:
With Christ, we have so much more. In Christ,
we do not merely have the status of Adam,

2497.95.text:
innocent before God. We are the adopted children
of God, sharing the very life and righteousness

2509.41.text:
of His most perfect Son. And He, the Son of
Man, is infallibly faithful. He has a glorious,

2523.27.text:
imperishable body that has defeated death.
Paul called it a spiritual body, a body suffused

2531.93.text:
with, energized by the Spirit. That's what
we will have. And when he appears, there will

2542.81.text:
be no threats, only the Tree of Life. And
brothers and sisters, with Christ, we have

2554.19.text:
His righteousness, a hope that outstrips Eden
itself. The creation that is now sliding back

2564.91.text:
into willful darkness will be suffused with
the bright glory of Christ. It will share

2573.24.text:
the liberation of the children of God. The
sound of weeping will no longer be heard.

2581.29.text:
The lion will lie down with the lamb. The
desert will bloom like the rose. The plowman

2591.56.text:
will overtake the reaper. The mountains will
run with new wine. And a Man, this time the

2604.67.text:
faithful Man, at peace with the Ancient of
Days, He will reign in this paradise. And

2615.38.text:
this Son of Man's wonderful rule will never
fall or be destroyed.

2639.59.text:
Shout for joy to the Lord all the earth. Burst
into jubilant song with music, with trumpets.

2649.66.text:
The blast of the ram's horn. Shout for joy
before the Lord, the King. Let the sea resound

2657.70.text:
and everything in it, the world, and all who
live in it. Let the rivers clap their hands.

2662.73.text:
Let the mountains sing for joy. Let them sing
before the Lord for He comes to judge the

2670.37.text:
earth. He will judge the world in righteousness
and the peoples with equity. Our glorious

2679.83.text:
Father, oh how we praise You for that day.
Come, send Your great Son. Send Him forth

2693.08.text:
once again. Come, Lord Jesus. Maranatha! Put
an end to this darkness. And Father, strengthen

2703.33.text:
our hearts and minds in the knowledge of this
magnificent hope for then we will sing for

2709.51.text:
joy to You, then we will proclaim Your great
salvation day after day to each other, to

2715.94.text:
the world. We will declare Your glory among
the nations, Your marvelous deeds among all

2724.96.text:
the peoples. Oh! With hearty praise we bless
Your Holy Name and thank you for this sweet

2735.87.text:
hope that we will be with You, and we Father
will be like Your beautiful Son in His world

2747.67.text:
made perfect. How we long for that day. Come,
Lord Jesus! Amen.
